sentence.Network_en: We all knew by then that the affair was practically over.
sentence.Network_cn: 到那时，我们都知道事情实际上已经结束了。

sentence.Network_en: The course is more practically based than the Masters degree.
sentence.Network_cn: 该课程比硕士学位课程更注重实践。

sentence.Network_en: I think racism is unconsciously inherent in practically everyone.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为种族偏见固有地存在于几乎所有人的潜意识中。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新编大学英语单词表(第二册) - 豆丁网 ... multiplication n. 乘法运算 practically ad. 几乎， 将近 sacrifice v. 牺牲.
新大纲四级 - xieyuchao670的日志 - 网易博客 ... powder 粉，粉末 practically 几乎，简直；实际上 pray 祈祷，祈求；请求，恳求.
《Friends》词... ... figment n. 臆造的事物, 虚构的事 practically adv. 实际上, 事实上, 在实践上 drooling vi. 流口水, 说昏话.
职称英语等级考试A - 原版英语_馆档网 ... practical 实际的，实用的 practically 几乎，简直，实际上 pray 祈祷，渴望，祈求.

list.abs: 形容人性格的词汇 ... popular 受欢迎的 practical 实际的 precise 一丝不苟的.
在每一情况中，那些传布民族主义计划者似乎要比那些转向阶级政治者来得更不“乌托邦”、且更为“实用”（practical）。毕竟，民族主义者顺循着随着资本主义到来而宰制世界的国族性意识形态。
与一种实践(practice).资格意指个人与国家之间的正式关系,亦即授与个人的公民和政治权利,如投票权,言论自由等;实践则包括政治生活 …

entry.def: Practically means almost, but not completely or exactly.

example.ex: He'd known the old man practically all his life...
example.tran: 他几乎打记事起就认识这个老人。

example.ex: I know people who find it practically impossible to give up smoking.
example.tran: 我认识一些人，他们觉得戒烟几乎是不可能的。

entry.def: You use practically to describe something which involves real actions or events rather than ideas or theories.

example.ex: The course is more practically based than the Masters degree...
example.tran: 该课程比硕士学位课程更注重实践。

example.ex: The British are not famed for their philosophy and tend to be more practically minded.
example.tran: 英国人不是以其哲学思想闻名，而是往往更注重实际。

sentences.sentence: "he was practically the only guest at the party"

means.word_mean: 2. (degree adverb used before a noun phrase) for all practical purposes but not completely;

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能实行的, 行得通的, 可以实行的
stems_affixes.word_buile: practice[v.实行]+able可以……的→adj.能实行的, 行得通的, 可以实行的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际的, 实践的, 实用的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pract实践,实际,应用+ical……的→adj.实际的, 实践的, 实用的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际上, 事实上, 在实践上;几乎, 简直
stems_affixes.word_buile: practical[adj.实际的, 实践的, 实用的]+ly表副词→adv.实际上, 事实上, 在实践上;几乎, 简直
pract实践,实际,应用+ise表动词→[美]v.实行;实践

Sentence.sentence: They practically beg a user to ignore the long-suffering professor struggling to pass on accumulated wisdom from the front of the room - a prospect that teachers find most irritating and students view as, well, inevitable.
You will also see a wide range of ethnic groups and nationals of practically every country.

sentences.en: She's practically always late for school.

means.word_mean: 实际地, 实事求是地

sentences.en: He solved the problem very practically.
sentences.cn: 他很实事求是地解决了这个问题。

jushi.english: She's practically always late for school.
The holidays are practically over; there's only one day left.
jushi.chinese: 假期差不多完了,只剩下一天了。

jushi.english: He solved the problem very practically.
jushi.chinese: 他很实事求是地解决了这个问题。
